title: How to Be Better at Shooting Games

steps.headline: Always have different weapons for different situations.
steps.description:
Here's a little chart to let you know if you're new to FPS games:
Assault Rifles are close to medium ranged weapons, they are NOT good for trickshots

steps.headline: Sub-machine Guns are very good in long range bad very BAD in short range.
If you are playing with a team, figure out what each member's role is (i.e.
steps.description: what their positions are) and then choose your gun.

steps.headline: If the enemies are behind cover, use your handy grenade.
steps.description: If they're far away use your rifle. If they are charging use your pistol, if they are in one group mow em down with your machine gun.

steps.headline: If you still die, stay back and provide cover for your team.
If one of your guns runs out of bullets, swap it.
Its good to protect your teammates as they can cover you during some missions in the game.
If there is an enemy vehicle kill the driver or blow it to pieces!

text:
Always have different weapons for different situations. Here's a little chart to let you know if you're new to FPS games: Assault Rifles are close to medium ranged weapons, they are NOT good for trickshots Sub-machine Guns are very good in long range bad very BAD in short range. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/a/a5/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/aid523573-v4-728px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"455","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Heavy Machine Guns are more experimental as they lack accuracy. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/36/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/aid523573-v4-728px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"455","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Shotguns are strictly close ranged weapons but are very effective in close range. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/5c/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/aid523573-v4-728px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"455","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Snipers are purely used for far ranged, but some people have proved this wrong and use them as close as Shotguns. They have the potential to kill an enemy in just one shot{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/4/42/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/aid523573-v4-728px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"455","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Melee are obviously close ranged. when the enemy is at an arms distance{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet6.jpg/v4-460px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet6.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b8/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet6.jpg/aid523573-v4-728px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"455","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The range of grenades varies widely in games, but are generally for medium range and used to flush out enemies in vantage points or in groups. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet7.jpg/v4-460px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet7.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/62/Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet7.jpg/aid523573-v4-728px-Be-Better-at-Shooting-Games-Step-1Bullet7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"455","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If you are playing with a team, figure out what each member's role is (i.e. what their positions are) and then choose your gun. If the enemies are behind cover, use your handy grenade. If they're far away use your rifle. If they are charging use your pistol, if they are in one group mow em down with your machine gun. If you still die, stay back and provide cover for your team. If one of your guns runs out of bullets, swap it. Its good to protect your teammates as they can cover you during some missions in the game. If there is an enemy vehicle kill the driver or blow it to pieces!
